intro: Pavetta phillipsiae, commonly known as the Philippine pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
